tool.name: Nicher_Masker

param.name: in_sdm_nc_path
param.dialogReference: A SDM NetCDF generated by the Nicher SDM module. Requires x and y dimensions with at least one variable.

param.name: in_mask_file_path
param.displayname: Input mask NetCDF or GeoTIFF file
param.dialogReference: A Digital Elevation Model (DEM) or Canopy Height Model (CHM) NetCDF or GeoTiff raster file.

param.name: out_masked_nc_path
param.dialogReference: The folder location and filename of the output NetCDF file containing masked SDM NetCDF.

param.name: in_min_value
param.dialogReference: The minimum value in the input Mask file to include as valid in the SDM NetCDF. Anything under this value will be masked out of the SDM NetCDF.

param.name: in_max_value
param.dialogReference:
The maximum value in the input Mask file to include as valid in the SDM NetCDF. Anything above this value will be masked out of the SDM NetCDF.

Note: Leave this blank to only mask values using the minimum value.

param.name: in_replacement_value
param.dialogReference: The value to use to replace masked out pixels in the SDM NetCDF. The default is set to 0, which represents "no habitat" within the SDM NetCDF.

tool.summary: Mask out areas of the SDM output NetCDF using another NetCDF or GeoTIFF. This module was created to allow users to take a Canopy Height Model (CHM) and remove areas of the SDM based on vegetation canopy height (e.g., remove all potential species habitat where vegetation canopy height is less than two metres). However, any layer can be used in input to act as a mask.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Lewis Trotter, Todd Robinson, Curtin University, FrontierSI, Digital Earth Australia, Geoscience Australia
